stories.text:
I'm a self-taught coder, 27yo and I have experience as a solution engineer (talking and light coding) at FAANG.

I could possibly segway into SWE in this role (if not FAANG then a startup), but I feel like I'm missing a lot of the underpinning theory (mostly mathematical and algo).

I'm really excited by the classes when I read through the BSc CS structure, and needless to say it would help me fill those gaps. I have enough savings to dedicate serious time to it, but its not the only way for me to get a SWE role, it would be partly for the enjoyment.

For those of you who have done CS at ug, is it worth it (beyond career setup)? Is it enjoyable for someone who likes coding?

Edit: I'm in Germany so the cost side of the cost-benefit is essentially just living costs.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the Value of a BSc Comp Sci?
